parameters.query:
SELECT 
    COALESCE(MAX(day_number), 0) + 1 as current_day,
    COUNT(*) as total_completed,
    ROUND(AVG(CASE WHEN is_correct THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100, 2) as accuracy
FROM progress p
LEFT JOIN user_answers ua ON p.id = ua.progress_id

parameters.query:
-- AWS SAA-C03 Certification Study Database Schema

-- Drop existing tables if they exist
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS user_answers CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS questions CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS progress CASCADE;

-- Progress tracking table
CREATE TABLE progress (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_DATE,
    day_number INTEGER NOT NULL,
    service VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    completed BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    content TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Questions bank table
CREATE TABLE questions (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    question_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_a TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_b TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_c TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_d TEXT NOT NULL,
    correct_answer CHAR(1) NOT NULL CHECK (correct_answer IN ('A', 'B', 'C', 'D')),
    explanation TEXT,
    service VARCHAR(100),
    difficulty VARCHAR(20) CHECK (difficulty IN ('easy', 'medium', 'hard')),
    category VARCHAR(100),
    tags TEXT[],
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- User answers tracking table
CREATE TABLE user_answers (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    question_id INTEGER REFERENCES questions(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    progress_id INTEGER REFERENCES progress(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    user_answer CHAR(1) CHECK (user_answer IN ('A', 'B', 'C', 'D')),
    is_correct BOOLEAN NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    response_time INTEGER -- in seconds
);

-- Create indexes for better performance
CREATE INDEX idx_progress_date ON progress(date);
CREATE INDEX idx_progress_day_number ON progress(day_number);
CREATE INDEX idx_progress_service ON progress(service);
CREATE INDEX idx_questions_service ON questions(service);
CREATE INDEX idx_questions_difficulty ON questions(difficulty);
CREATE INDEX idx_user_answers_timestamp ON user_answers(timestamp);
CREATE INDEX idx_user_answers_is_correct ON user_answers(is_correct);

-- Create a view for progress statistics
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW progress_stats AS
SELECT 
    MAX(p.day_number) as current_day,
    COUNT(DISTINCT p.date) as study_days,
    COUNT(ua.id) as total_questions_answered,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ua.is_correct THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as correct_answers,
    ROUND(AVG(CASE WHEN ua.is_correct THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100, 2) as accuracy_percentage,
    COUNT(DISTINCT p.service) as services_studied
FROM progress p
LEFT JOIN user_answers ua ON p.id = ua.progress_id;

-- Create a view for weak areas
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW weak_areas AS
SELECT 
    q.service,
    COUNT(*) as total_questions,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ua.is_correct THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) as incorrect_count,
    ROUND(AVG(CASE WHEN ua.is_correct THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) * 100, 2) as error_rate
FROM user_answers ua
JOIN questions q ON ua.question_id = q.id
GROUP BY q.service
HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3
ORDER BY error_rate DESC;

-- Insert some sample questions for testing
INSERT INTO questions (question_text, option_a, option_b, option_c, option_d, correct_answer, explanation, service, difficulty, category) VALUES
(
    'A company needs to store frequently accessed data with millisecond latency. The data must be highly available across multiple Availability Zones. Which storage solution should be used?',
    'Amazon S3 Standard',
    'Amazon ElastiCache',
    'Amazon EBS with Multi-Attach',
    'Amazon S3 Glacier',
    'B',
    'ElastiCache provides sub-millisecond latency for frequently accessed data and supports Multi-AZ deployments. S3 has higher latency, EBS Multi-Attach is limited to specific instance types, and Glacier is for archival storage.',
    'ElastiCache',
    'medium',
    'Storage & Caching'
),
(
    'An application running on EC2 instances needs to access S3 buckets without using long-term credentials. What is the MOST secure way to grant this access?',
    'Store AWS credentials in the application code',
    'Create an IAM role and attach it to the EC2 instances',
    'Use AWS access keys stored in environment variables',
    'Create a bucket policy allowing public access',
    'B',
    'IAM roles provide temporary credentials that are automatically rotated, eliminating the need to manage long-term credentials. This is the most secure approach for EC2 instances accessing AWS services.',
    'IAM',
    'easy',
    'Security & Identity'
),
(
    'A startup needs to deploy a web application that can scale automatically based on traffic. They want minimal operational overhead and pay only for actual usage. Which solution is MOST appropriate?',
    'EC2 instances with Auto Scaling and Application Load Balancer',
    'AWS Lambda with API Gateway',
    'Elastic Beanstalk with Auto Scaling',
    'ECS Fargate with Application Load Balancer',
    'B',
    'Lambda with API Gateway provides serverless architecture with automatic scaling, zero operational overhead, and true pay-per-use pricing. Other options require more management or may have idle capacity costs.',
    'Lambda',
    'medium',
    'Compute'
),
(
    'A company wants to implement disaster recovery for their RDS database with an RTO of 5 minutes and RPO of 1 hour. Which solution meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?',
    'Multi-AZ deployment with automated backups',
    'Read replicas in another region with manual promotion',
    'Automated snapshots every hour',
    'Database migration to DynamoDB global tables',
    'A',
    'Multi-AZ provides automatic failover in minutes (meeting RTO) and synchronous replication (meeting RPO). Read replicas require manual promotion (slower), snapshots may exceed RTO, and DynamoDB migration is unnecessary and expensive.',
    'RDS',
    'hard',
    'Database'
),
(
    'An application generates large log files that need to be analyzed occasionally. The logs must be retained for 7 years for compliance. What is the MOST cost-effective storage solution?',
    'S3 Standard with lifecycle policy to Glacier Deep Archive after 90 days',
    'EBS volumes with snapshots',
    'S3 Glacier Instant Retrieval',
    'EFS with Lifecycle Management',
    'A',
    'S3 Standard for active logs transitioning to Glacier Deep Archive provides the most cost-effective long-term storage for rarely accessed data. Glacier Deep Archive has the lowest storage cost for 7-year retention.',
    'S3',
    'medium',
    'Storage & Archival'
);

-- Function to get next question for a user (avoiding recent questions)
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_next_question()
RETURNS TABLE (
    id INTEGER,
    question_text TEXT,
    option_a TEXT,
    option_b TEXT,
    option_c TEXT,
    option_d TEXT,
    service VARCHAR(100),
    difficulty VARCHAR(20)
) AS $$
BEGIN
    RETURN QUERY
    SELECT q.id, q.question_text, q.option_a, q.option_b, q.option_c, q.option_d, q.service, q.difficulty
    FROM questions q
    WHERE q.id NOT IN (
        SELECT question_id 
        FROM user_answers 
        WHERE timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day'
    )
    ORDER BY RANDOM()
    LIMIT 1;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

-- Function to calculate streak
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_study_streak()
RETURNS INTEGER AS $$
DECLARE
    streak INTEGER := 0;
    check_date DATE := CURRENT_DATE;
BEGIN
    LOOP
        IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM progress WHERE date = check_date) THEN
            streak := streak + 1;
            check_date := check_date - INTERVAL '1 day';
        ELSE
            EXIT;
        END IF;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN streak;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

-- Insert initial progress entry
INSERT INTO progress (date, day_number, service, completed) 
VALUES (CURRENT_DATE, 1, 'Getting Started', FALSE)
ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING;

-- Grant permissions (adjust as needed)
-- GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON ALL TABLES IN SCHEMA public TO n8n;
-- GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON ALL SEQUENCES IN SCHEMA public TO n8n;
-- GRANT EXECUTE ON ALL FUNCTIONS IN SCHEMA public TO n8n;

COMMENT ON TABLE progress IS 'Tracks daily study progress and completed services';
COMMENT ON TABLE questions IS 'Question bank for AWS SAA-C03 certification practice';
COMMENT ON TABLE user_answers IS 'Records user responses and performance metrics';
COMMENT ON VIEW progress_stats IS 'Aggregated statistics about study progress';
COMMENT ON VIEW weak_areas IS 'Identifies services where user needs more practice';

ðŸ“˜ **SERVICE: {{$json.currentService}}**

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AWS Solutions Architect Associate (SAA-C03) exam expert and coach.

Generate comprehensive study material for **{{$json.currentService}}** - Day {{$json.dayNumber}}/65. Limit the response length to 4000 characters.

messageValues.message: Format this text to be sent in telegram, if exceeding 4000 characters summarize it and format it always in plain simple text and use text format compatible with telegram markdown

parameters.query:
=SELECT 
  COUNT(*) as total_questions,
  SUM(CASE WHEN is_correct THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as correct_answers,
  ROUND(AVG(CASE WHEN is_correct THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100, 2) as accuracy,
  COUNT(DISTINCT DATE(timestamp)) as study_days,
  MAX(day_number) as current_day,
  (SELECT STRING_AGG(DISTINCT service, ', ') 
   FROM (
     SELECT service, COUNT(*) as cnt
     FROM user_answers ua
     JOIN questions q ON ua.question_id = q.id
     WHERE NOT is_correct
     GROUP BY service
     ORDER BY cnt DESC
     LIMIT 3
   ) weak_areas) as weak_services
FROM user_answers ua
JOIN progress p ON ua.progress_id = p.id

parameters.query:
SELECT q.question_text, q.option_a, q.option_b, q.option_c, q.option_d, 
       q.correct_answer, q.explanation, ua.user_answer
FROM user_answers ua
JOIN questions q ON ua.question_id = q.id
WHERE ua.is_correct = false
ORDER BY ua.timestamp DESC
LIMIT 5

=SELECT id, question_text, option_a, option_b, option_c, option_d, correct_answer
FROM questions
WHERE id NOT IN (
  SELECT question_id 
  FROM user_answers 
  WHERE timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day'
)
ORDER BY RANDOM()
LIMIT 1

=SELECT * FROM questions 
WHERE id = (SELECT MAX(id) FROM questions)

SELECT COALESCE(MAX(day_number), 0) + 1 as current_day, 
       COUNT(*) as total_completed,
       ROUND(AVG(CASE WHEN is_correct THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100, 2) as accuracy
FROM progress p
LEFT JOIN user_answers ua ON p.id = ua.progress_id

Format each question as:

**Q[number]/5: [Scenario description]**

**Question:** [What is the best solution?]

A) [Option]
B) [Option]
C) [Option]
D) [Option]











**Correct Answer:** [Letter]
**Explanation:** [Why this is correct and others are wrong]

---

Make questions progressively harder. Include at least one multi-service integration scenario. Send the questions one by one using the telegram tool. Format the text and make it compatible with telehgram and avoid having this issue "Bad Request: can't parse entities: Can't find end of the entity starting at byte offset 1927"
Finally, log every quetsion on the postgres table using the postgres insert tool. The table columns are defined as follow "CREATE TABLE questions (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    question_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_a TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_b TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_c TEXT NOT NULL,
    option_d TEXT NOT NULL,
    correct_answer CHAR(1) NOT NULL CHECK (correct_answer IN ('A', 'B', 'C', 'D')),
    explanation TEXT,
    service VARCHAR(100),
    difficulty VARCHAR(20) CHECK (difficulty IN ('easy', 'medium', 'hard')),
    category VARCHAR(100),
    tags TEXT[],
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
)""
